title: rustdoc panics when resolving intra doc link

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: A-intra-doc-links
labels.description: Area: Intra-doc links, the ability to link to items in docs by name

body:
Running `cargo +nightly doc` on the crate [`off-rs`](https://github.com/michidk/off-rs) fails with a (semi-unrelated) panic. This currently also fails to build on `docs.rs`: This started to occur with the latest nightly version (`rustc 1.60.0-nightly (21b4a9cfd 2022-01-27)`). ### Probable cause The issue is probably related to the following doc comment line: . Specifically the intra doc link causes `rustdoc` to fail. ```rust /// When these limits are exceeded during the [`parse`](`crate::parser::Parser::parse`) ``` When this line is replaced with the follwing (adding an anonymous lifetime) line `rustdoc` finishes successfully: ```rust /// When these limits are exceeded during the [`parse`](`crate::parser::Parser::<'_>::parse`) ``` ### Minimal viable example The example below will also panic - The intra doc link beeing in an extra module is important as it otherwise will not panic but succeed - It must be ```[`crate:: ...`]```, with ```[`super:: ...`]``` it will succeed. ```rust pub struct Test<'a> { data: &'a (), } impl<'a> Test<'a> { pub fn do_test(&self) {} } pub mod demo { //! [`crate::Test::do_test`] } ``` ### Related Related issues: - https://github.com/rust-lang/docs.rs/issues/1630 - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/93422 ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.60.0-nightly (21b4a9cfd 2022-01-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 21b4a9cfdcbb1e76f4b36b5c3cfd64d627285093 commit-date: 2022-01-27 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.60.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ```
Backtrace

`docs.rs` error: `RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo +nightly doc`: ``` Documenting off-rs v0.1.3 (/home/mtx/tmp/off-rs) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no entry found for key', src/librustdoc/passes/collect_intra_doc_links.rs:929:16 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/21b4a9cfdcbb1e76f4b36b5c3cfd64d627285093/library/std/src/panicking.rs:577:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/21b4a9cfdcbb1e76f4b36b5c3cfd64d627285093/library/core/src/panicking.rs:135:14 2: core::panicking::panic_display at /rustc/21b4a9cfdcbb1e76f4b36b5c3cfd64d627285093/library/core/src/panicking.rs:65:5 3: core::panicking::panic_str at /rustc/21b4a9cfdcbb1e76f4b36b5c3cfd64d627285093/library/core/src/panicking.rs:56:5 4: core::option::expect_failed at /rustc/21b4a9cfdcbb1e76f4b36b5c3cfd64d627285093/library/core/src/option.rs:1840:5 5: rustdoc::passes::collect_intra_doc_links::resolve_associated_trait_item 6: ::resolve_associated_item 7: ::resolve 8: ::resolve_link 9: ::visit_item 10: ::visit_inner_recur 11: ::visit_item 12: ::visit_inner_recur 13: ::visit_item 14: ::visit_inner_recur 15: ::visit_item 16: rustdoc::passes::collect_intra_doc_links::collect_intra_doc_links 17: ::time:: 18: rustdoc::core::run_global_ctxt 19: ::time::<(rustdoc::clean::types::Crate, rustdoc::config::RenderOptions, rustdoc::formats::cache::Cache), rustdoc::main_options::{closure#0}::{closure#0}::{closure#1}::{closure#0}> 20: ::enter::> 21: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustdoc::main_options::{closure#0}>::{closure#1}> 22: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run::, rustdoc::main_options::{closure#0}> 23: rustdoc::main_options 24: >::set::>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic error: Unrecognized option: 'crate-version' error: could not document `off-rs` Caused by: process didn't exit successfully: `rustdoc --edition=2021 --crate-type lib --crate-name off_rs src/lib.rs -o /home/mtx/tmp/off-rs/target/doc --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi,artifacts,future-incompat -C metadata=d6899838058215b9 -L dependency=/home/mtx/tmp/off-rs/target/debug/deps --crate-version 0.1.3` (exit status: 1) ```
